questions.question: In a triangle, two interior angles measure <math><mn>54</mn><mo>°</mo></math> and <math><mn>71</mn><mo>°</mo></math>. What is the measure of the third interior angle?
questions.explanation: The sum of the interior angles of a triangle is <math><mn>180</mn><mo>°</mo></math>. The third angle is <math><mn>180</mn><mo>°</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>54</mn><mo>°</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>71</mn><mo>°</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>55</mn><mo>°</mo></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: When you see a triangle, check if angle sum <math><mn>180</mn><mo>°</mo></math> applies immediately.

questions.question: Two adjacent angles form a straight line. One angle measures <math><mn>112</mn><mo>°</mo></math>. What is the measure of the other angle?
questions.explanation: Angles that form a straight line are supplementary and sum to <math><mn>180</mn><mo>°</mo></math>. The other angle is <math><mn>180</mn><mo>°</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>112</mn><mo>°</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>68</mn><mo>°</mo></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: If the figure is a straight line, write <math><mi>a</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>b</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>180</mn></math> right away.

questions.question_chart_svg: <svg width='400' height='260' viewBox='0 0 400 260' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect width='400' height='260' fill='white' /><line x1='60' y1='210' x2='340' y2='50' stroke='black' stroke-width='2' /><line x1='60' y1='50' x2='340' y2='210' stroke='black' stroke-width='2' /><circle cx='200' cy='130' r='3' fill='black' /><text x='212' y='124' font-size='14'>O</text><path d='M200 130 L250 101 A60 60 0 0 1 230 160 Z' fill='none' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><text x='254' y='104' font-size='14'>x°</text><text x='120' y='194' font-size='14'>60°</text></svg>
questions.question_chart_description: Two lines intersect at point O. One of the angles is labeled 60 degrees and the vertical angle is labeled x degrees.
questions.question: In the figure, two lines intersect at point O. One of the angles measures <math><mn>60</mn><mo>°</mo></math>. What is the value of <math><mi>x</mi></math>?
questions.explanation: Vertical angles are congruent. Since <math><mi>x</mi><mo>°</mo></math> is vertical to the <math><mn>60</mn><mo>°</mo></math> angle, <math><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>60</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: At an intersection, vertical angles are equal; linear pairs sum to <math><mn>180</mn></math>.

questions.question: Triangle ABC is isosceles with <math><mi>A</mi><mi>B</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>A</mi><mi>C</mi></math>. If angle A measures <math><mn>38</mn><mo>°</mo></math>, what is the measure of angle B in degrees? (Enter an integer.)
questions.explanation: If <math><mi>A</mi><mi>B</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>A</mi><mi>C</mi></math>, then angles B and C are equal. Let each be <math><mi>x</mi><mo>°</mo></math>. Then <math><mn>38</mn><mo>°</mo><mo>+</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>°</mo><mo>+</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>°</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>180</mn><mo>°</mo></math>, so <math><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>142</mn></math> and <math><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>71</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: In an isosceles triangle, equal sides are opposite equal angles; set the two base angles equal immediately.

questions.question_chart_svg: <svg width='400' height='260' viewBox='0 0 400 260' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect width='400' height='260' fill='white' /><line x1='50' y1='70' x2='350' y2='70' stroke='black' stroke-width='2' /><line x1='50' y1='190' x2='350' y2='190' stroke='black' stroke-width='2' /><line x1='120' y1='20' x2='280' y2='240' stroke='black' stroke-width='2' /><text x='238' y='62' font-size='14'>m°</text><text x='140' y='212' font-size='14'>132°</text></svg>
questions.question_chart_description: Two parallel horizontal lines are cut by a slanted transversal. One interior angle on the lower line is labeled 132 degrees, and the corresponding interior angle on the upper line is labeled m degrees.
questions.question: In the figure, the two horizontal lines are parallel. The angle labeled <math><mi>m</mi><mo>°</mo></math> and the angle labeled <math><mn>132</mn><mo>°</mo></math> are corresponding angles. What is the value of <math><mi>m</mi></math>?
questions.explanation: When parallel lines are cut by a transversal, corresponding angles are congruent. Therefore <math><mi>m</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>132</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: For parallel lines, label corresponding positions (like “F shapes”) to match equal angles quickly.

questions.question: In triangle PQR, the measure of the exterior angle at vertex Q is <math><mn>118</mn><mo>°</mo></math>. If angle P measures <math><mn>47</mn><mo>°</mo></math>, what is the measure of angle R?
questions.explanation: An exterior angle equals the sum of the two remote interior angles. So <math><mn>118</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>47</mn><mo>+</mo><mi>r</mi></math>, where <math><mi>r</mi></math> is the measure of angle R in degrees. Then <math><mi>r</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>71</mn></math>, so angle R measures <math><mn>71</mn><mo>°</mo></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Exterior angle theorem is often faster than using <math><mn>180</mn><mo>°</mo></math> twice.

questions.question_chart_svg: <svg width='400' height='260' viewBox='0 0 400 260' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect width='400' height='260' fill='white' /><polygon points='80,210 320,210 200,70' stroke='black' fill='none' stroke-width='2' /><line x1='200' y1='70' x2='200' y2='210' stroke='black' stroke-width='2' /><text x='66' y='228' font-size='14'>A</text><text x='324' y='228' font-size='14'>C</text><text x='194' y='60' font-size='14'>B</text><text x='207' y='150' font-size='14'>D</text><text x='106' y='200' font-size='14'>34°</text></svg>
questions.question_chart_description: Triangle ABC with base AC horizontal and vertex B above. Segment BD is drawn to the midpoint of AC. Angle A is labeled 34 degrees.
questions.question: In the figure, triangle ABC is isosceles with <math><mi>A</mi><mi>B</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>B</mi><mi>C</mi></math>. Segment BD is drawn from B to the midpoint D of AC. If angle A measures <math><mn>34</mn><mo>°</mo></math>, what is the measure of angle DBC?
questions.explanation: Since <math><mi>A</mi><mi>B</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>B</mi><mi>C</mi></math>, angles A and C are equal, so angle C is <math><mn>34</mn><mo>°</mo></math>. Then angle B is <math><mn>180</mn><mo>°</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>34</mn><mo>°</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>34</mn><mo>°</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>112</mn><mo>°</mo></math>. In an isosceles triangle, the segment from the vertex to the midpoint of the base bisects the vertex angle, so angle DBC is <math><mfrac><mn>112</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>56</mn><mo>°</mo></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: In an isosceles triangle, the line from vertex to base midpoint is often an angle bisector and altitude.

questions.question: Two lines intersect. One angle at the intersection measures <math><mn>5</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>10</mn><mo>°</mo></math>, and its adjacent angle measures <math><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>50</mn><mo>°</mo></math>. What is the value of <math><mi>x</mi></math>? (Enter an integer.)
questions.explanation: Adjacent angles at an intersection that form a straight line are supplementary: <math><mo>(</mo><mn>5</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>10</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>50</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>180</mn></math>. So <math><mn>8</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>60</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>180</mn></math>, giving <math><mn>8</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>120</mn></math> and <math><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>15</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Translate words like “adjacent on a straight line” into one equation: sum equals <math><mn>180</mn></math>.

questions.question: Line <math><mi>l</mi></math> has slope <math><mn>2</mn></math>. Line <math><mi>m</mi></math> is perpendicular to line <math><mi>l</mi></math>. What is the slope of line <math><mi>m</mi></math>?
questions.explanation: For non-vertical perpendicular lines, the slopes are negative reciprocals. The negative reciprocal of <math><mn>2</mn></math> is <math><mn>-</mn><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Perpendicular slopes multiply to <math><mn>-</mn><mn>1</mn></math> (when both slopes are defined).

questions.question: In triangle XYZ, angle X measures <math><mn>2</mn><mi>a</mi><mo>°</mo></math>, angle Y measures <math><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>30</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>°</mo></math>, and angle Z measures <math><mn>60</mn><mo>°</mo></math>. What is the value of <math><mi>a</mi></math>?
questions.explanation: Use the triangle angle sum: <math><mn>2</mn><mi>a</mi><mo>+</mo><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>30</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>60</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>180</mn></math>. Then <math><mn>3</mn><mi>a</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>90</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>180</mn></math>, so <math><mn>3</mn><mi>a</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>90</mn></math> and <math><mi>a</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>30</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Write one angle-sum equation first; solve before looking at choices.

questions.question_chart_svg: <svg width='420' height='280' viewBox='0 0 420 280' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect width='420' height='280' fill='white' /><line x1='50' y1='70' x2='370' y2='70' stroke='black' stroke-width='2' /><line x1='50' y1='210' x2='370' y2='210' stroke='black' stroke-width='2' /><line x1='110' y1='250' x2='290' y2='30' stroke='black' stroke-width='2' /><polygon points='143,210 300,210 220,116' stroke='black' fill='none' stroke-width='2' /><circle cx='143' cy='210' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='300' cy='210' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='220' cy='116' r='3' fill='black' /><text x='128' y='232' font-size='14'>A</text><text x='304' y='232' font-size='14'>B</text><text x='226' y='112' font-size='14'>C</text><text x='248' y='64' font-size='14'>126°</text><text x='274' y='202' font-size='14'>54°</text></svg>
questions.question_chart_description: Two parallel horizontal lines are cut by a transversal. Points A and B lie on the lower line and point C lies on the transversal above the lower line, forming triangle ABC. An angle of 126 degrees is shown at the upper intersection, and angle ABC is shown as 54 degrees.
questions.question: In the figure, the two horizontal lines are parallel. Segment AC lies on the transversal. The angle formed by the transversal and the upper line is <math><mn>126</mn><mo>°</mo></math>. Angle ABC measures <math><mn>54</mn><mo>°</mo></math>. What is the measure of angle ACB?
questions.explanation: The <math><mn>126</mn><mo>°</mo></math> angle is supplementary to the acute angle the transversal makes with a horizontal line, so that acute angle is <math><mn>180</mn><mo>°</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>126</mn><mo>°</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>54</mn><mo>°</mo></math>. Because the lines are parallel, the corresponding acute angle between the transversal (segment AC) and the lower line at A is also <math><mn>54</mn><mo>°</mo></math>, so angle CAB is <math><mn>54</mn><mo>°</mo></math>. In triangle ABC, angle ACB is <math><mn>180</mn><mo>°</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>54</mn><mo>°</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>54</mn><mo>°</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>72</mn><mo>°</mo></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: With parallel lines, first convert obtuse angles to the acute angle you need using a supplement to <math><mn>180</mn></math>.

questions.question: In triangle DEF, angle D measures <math><mn>28</mn><mo>°</mo></math>. The bisector of angle E divides angle E into two angles that each measure <math><mn>41</mn><mo>°</mo></math>. What is the measure of angle F?
questions.explanation: Angle E is split into two equal angles of <math><mn>41</mn><mo>°</mo></math>, so angle E is <math><mn>82</mn><mo>°</mo></math>. Then angle F is <math><mn>180</mn><mo>°</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>28</mn><mo>°</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>82</mn><mo>°</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>70</mn><mo>°</mo></math>. Therefore the correct value is <math><mn>70</mn><mo>°</mo></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: If an angle is bisected, double the given half-angle before using triangle sum.

questions.question: In triangle ABC, angle A measures <math><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>15</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>°</mo></math>, angle B measures <math><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>°</mo></math>, and angle C measures <math><mn>70</mn><mo>°</mo></math>. What is the value of <math><mi>x</mi></math>? (Enter an integer.)
questions.explanation: Use the triangle angle sum: <math><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>15</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>70</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>180</mn></math>. Then <math><mn>5</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>80</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>180</mn></math>, so <math><mn>5</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>100</mn></math> and <math><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>20</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Combine like terms immediately; it prevents arithmetic slips on multi-angle equations.

questions.question_chart_svg: <svg width='420' height='280' viewBox='0 0 420 280' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect width='420' height='280' fill='white' /><polygon points='70,230 350,230 240,70' stroke='black' fill='none' stroke-width='2' /><line x1='240' y1='70' x2='160' y2='230' stroke='black' stroke-width='2' /><text x='58' y='250' font-size='14'>A</text><text x='352' y='250' font-size='14'>C</text><text x='236' y='60' font-size='14'>B</text><text x='144' y='226' font-size='14'>D</text><text x='92' y='220' font-size='14'>50°</text><text x='190' y='120' font-size='14'>x°</text></svg>
questions.question_chart_description: Triangle ABC with point D on AC and segment BD drawn. Angle A is 50 degrees. Angle between BA and BD at B is labeled x degrees.
questions.question: In the figure, triangle ABC is isosceles with <math><mi>A</mi><mi>B</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>B</mi><mi>C</mi></math>. Point D lies on segment AC, and segment BD is drawn. Angle A measures <math><mn>50</mn><mo>°</mo></math>, and angle ABD measures <math><mi>x</mi><mo>°</mo></math>. If angle DBC also measures <math><mi>x</mi><mo>°</mo></math>, what is the value of <math><mi>x</mi></math>?
questions.explanation: Since <math><mi>A</mi><mi>B</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>B</mi><mi>C</mi></math>, angles A and C are equal. Angle A is <math><mn>50</mn><mo>°</mo></math>, so angle C is <math><mn>50</mn><mo>°</mo></math>, and angle B is <math><mn>180</mn><mo>°</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>50</mn><mo>°</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>50</mn><mo>°</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>80</mn><mo>°</mo></math>. The angles ABD and DBC partition angle B into two equal angles <math><mi>x</mi><mo>°</mo></math> and <math><mi>x</mi><mo>°</mo></math>, so <math><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>80</mn></math> and <math><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>40</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: When a segment splits an angle into equal parts, write a quick “two pieces sum to the whole” equation.

questions.question: In triangle JKL, angle K is a right angle. Angle J measures <math><mn>3</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>°</mo></math>, and angle L measures <math><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>°</mo></math>. What is the value of <math><mi>t</mi></math>?
questions.explanation: Angle K is <math><mn>90</mn><mo>°</mo></math>. Using angle sum: <math><mn>3</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>90</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>180</mn></math>. Then <math><mn>5</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>95</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>180</mn></math>, so <math><mn>5</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>85</mn></math> and <math><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>17</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: If a right angle is given, substitute <math><mn>90</mn></math> immediately to reduce steps.

questions.question: Lines <math><mi>p</mi></math> and <math><mi>q</mi></math> are parallel and cut by a transversal. One of the interior angles between the lines measures <math><mn>97</mn><mo>°</mo></math>. What is the measure of the alternate interior angle?
questions.explanation: Alternate interior angles are congruent when lines are parallel. Therefore the alternate interior angle also measures <math><mn>97</mn><mo>°</mo></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: For parallel lines, memorize: corresponding and alternate interior angles are equal; same-side interior angles sum to <math><mn>180</mn></math>.

questions.question: Two lines intersect to form four angles. One angle measures <math><mo>(</mo><mn>7</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>18</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>°</mo></math>, and the vertical angle measures <math><mo>(</mo><mn>5</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>22</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>°</mo></math>. What is the value of <math><mi>x</mi></math>? (Enter an integer.)
questions.explanation: Vertical angles are congruent, so set them equal: <math><mn>7</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>18</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>22</mn></math>. Then <math><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>40</mn></math>, so <math><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>20</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: For intersecting lines, start by deciding whether you need a vertical-angle equation (equal) or a linear-pair equation (sum to <math><mn>180</mn></math>).

questions.question_chart_svg: <svg width='420' height='280' viewBox='0 0 420 280' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect width='420' height='280' fill='white' /><polygon points='90,220 330,220 240,90' stroke='black' fill='none' stroke-width='2' /><line x1='240' y1='90' x2='200' y2='220' stroke='black' stroke-width='2' /><circle cx='90' cy='220' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='330' cy='220' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='240' cy='90' r='3' fill='black' /><circle cx='200' cy='220' r='3' fill='black' /><text x='74' y='244' font-size='14'>A</text><text x='334' y='244' font-size='14'>C</text><text x='244' y='86' font-size='14'>B</text><text x='184' y='244' font-size='14'>D</text><text x='214' y='140' font-size='14'>35°</text><text x='252' y='140' font-size='14'>25°</text></svg>
questions.question_chart_description: Triangle ABC with point D on segment AC and segment BD drawn. The angle at B is split into two angles labeled 35 degrees and 25 degrees.
questions.question: In triangle ABC, point D lies on segment AC. Segment BD is drawn so that angle ABD measures <math><mn>35</mn><mo>°</mo></math> and angle DBC measures <math><mn>25</mn><mo>°</mo></math>. If angle A measures <math><mn>50</mn><mo>°</mo></math>, what is the measure of angle C?
questions.explanation: Angle ABC is split into two angles, so <math><mo>∠</mo><mi>A</mi><mi>B</mi><mi>C</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>35</mn><mo>°</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>25</mn><mo>°</mo></math>, which is <math><mn>60</mn><mo>°</mo></math>. Then use the triangle angle sum: <math><mn>50</mn><mo>°</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>60</mn><mo>°</mo><mo>+</mo><mo>∠</mo><mi>A</mi><mi>C</mi><mi>B</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>180</mn><mo>°</mo></math>, so <math><mo>∠</mo><mi>A</mi><mi>C</mi><mi>B</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>70</mn><mo>°</mo></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: If an angle is split into two labeled angles, add them first before using <math><mn>180</mn></math>.

questions.question: In triangle MNO, angle M measures <math><mn>46</mn><mo>°</mo></math>. A line through N is drawn parallel to segment MO, forming an angle of <math><mi>k</mi><mo>°</mo></math> with segment NM on the outside of the triangle. What is the value of <math><mi>k</mi></math>?
questions.explanation: The line through N is parallel to MO, so the angle it makes with NM corresponds to angle M. The corresponding interior angle is <math><mn>46</mn><mo>°</mo></math>, but the angle asked is an exterior angle on the outside, which is supplementary: <math><mn>180</mn><mo>°</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>46</mn><mo>°</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>134</mn><mo>°</mo></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Parallel lines create corresponding angles; then decide whether the problem asks for the interior angle or its supplement.

questions.question: In triangle RST, angles R and S are congruent. Angle T measures <math><mn>34</mn><mo>°</mo></math>. What is the measure of angle R in degrees? (Enter an integer.)
questions.explanation: If angles R and S are congruent, let each be <math><mi>x</mi><mo>°</mo></math>. Then <math><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>34</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>180</mn></math>, so <math><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>146</mn></math> and <math><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>73</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: When you see two congruent angles, replace both with a single variable before using the <math><mn>180</mn></math> sum.
